headline.print_headline: In Germany’s Most Populous State, a Regional Leader Rises to Challenge Merkel
headline.seo: Hannelore Kraft Raises Challenge to Merkel in Germany
headline.main: In Germany’s Most Populous State, a Regional Leader Rises to Challenge Merkel

docs.snippet: The Social Democrats are hoping that state elections on Sunday in North Rhine-Westphalia, the country’s most populous state, will lead to the end of Chancellor Angela Merkel’s seven-year reign....
docs.abstract: Social Democrats, being led by Hannelore Kraft, hope that state elections in North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany’s most populous state, will lead to the end of Chancellor Angela Merkel’s seven-year reign.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Social Democrats are hoping that state elections on Sunday in North Rhine-Westphalia, the country’s most populous state, will lead to the end of Chancellor Angela Merkel’s seven-year reign.

headline.print_headline: Iran Is Pressing For Top Official As Shiite Leader
headline.seo: Iran Promotes Its Candidate for Next Shiite Leader
headline.main: Iran Presses for Official to Be Next Leader of Shiites

docs.snippet: Ayatollah Mahmoud Hashemi Shahroudi would extend Iran’s influence over the Iraqi people and Shiite Muslims everywhere if he were to succeed Grand Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani....
docs.abstract: Iran is positioning hard-line cleric Ayatollah Mahmoud Hashemi Shahroudi to succeed 81-year-old Grand Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani of Iraq, the spiritual leader of the Shiite Muslim world; succession battle has profound implications for all Shiite Muslims and for the role of democracy in the Islamic world; Iran would forcefully expand its influence over Iraq should Shahroudi prove successful.
docs.lead_paragraph: Ayatollah Mahmoud Hashemi Shahroudi would extend Iran’s influence over the Iraqi people and Shiite Muslims everywhere if he were to succeed Grand Ayatollah Ali al-Sistani.

headline.print_headline: Cryptic Calendar And the People Who Made It
headline.seo: ‘Maya 2012: Lords of Time,’ at the Penn Museum
headline.main: Cryptic Calendar and the People Who Made It

docs.snippet: “Maya 2012: Lords of Time” at the Penn Museum explores the culture of the Maya, who thrived in a classic period from A.D. 250 to 900 in southern Mexico, Guatemala, Honduras, Belize and El Salvador....

keywords.value: University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Edward Rothstein reviews exhibit Maya 2012: Lords of Time, which explores the ancient Mayan civilization, at the University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology.
docs.lead_paragraph: “Maya 2012: Lords of Time” at the Penn Museum explores the culture of the Maya, who thrived in a classic period from A.D. 250 to 900 in southern Mexico, Guatemala, Honduras, Belize and El Salvador.

headline.print_headline: Romney’s Adversarial View of Russia Stirs Debate
headline.seo: Romney’s View of Russia Stirs Debate
headline.main: Romney’s Adversarial View of Russia Stirs Debate

docs.snippet: Many Democrats, some Republicans and the Russians themselves suggest that Mitt Romney is stuck in a cold war mind-set....
docs.abstract: Presumptive Republican presidential nominee Mitt Romney's declaration that Russia is America's top geopolitical adversary caused many Democrats, some Republicans and the Russians themselves to suggest that Romney is stuck in a cold war mind-set; Romney has long held hawkish views on Russia, which has stirred debate in the Republican Party and in his own close circle of advisers.
docs.lead_paragraph: Many Democrats, some Republicans and the Russians themselves suggest that Mitt Romney is stuck in a cold war mind-set.

headline.print_headline: Same-Sex Marriage Activists Look to Law
headline.seo: Path to Same-Sex Marriage Probably Runs Through Courts
headline.main: Same-Sex Marriage Activists Look to Law

docs.snippet: Efforts by gays and lesbians to overcome the legal obstacles faced by same-sex couples, notably the Defense of Marriage Act, may best be fought in courtrooms....

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Tara Siegel Bernard Your Money column examines several court cases challenging the Defense of Marriage Act, 1996 federal law that defines marriage as between one man and one woman; contends that cases represent the best chance to address the long list of extra costs and legal hurdles faced by same-sex couples.
docs.lead_paragraph: Efforts by gays and lesbians to overcome the legal obstacles faced by same-sex couples, notably the Defense of Marriage Act, may best be fought in courtrooms.

headline.print_headline: The Queens D.A. Defends His Booking Program
headline.main: The Queens D.A. Defends His Booking Program

docs.snippet: The Queens district attorney says the program has nothing to do with trying to get around the Miranda rule....
docs.abstract: Letter from Queens County District Attorney Richard A Brown responds to May 3 editorial claiming that his office has undermined the basic principle of Miranda Rule by interrogating suspects before they are arraigned.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Queens district attorney says the program has nothing to do with trying to get around the Miranda rule.
